remarks.para: The class derives from the abstract class . At run time, the hosts a control that allows users to edit text.
Special properties added to the class include , and . These properties allow you to access the hosted control and its attributes, and set the format for displaying values.

If the data source is a containing objects, the property of the should be set to a data type that can logically be edited in a text box control. The following data types are automatically associated with a : , , , , , , , , , , , and .
[Visual Basic]

block.para: The following types are not fully supported by Visual Basic: , , , , and . (Operators are not allowed.)

remarks.para: This method rolls back any change made to the column and invokes the and methods.

summary.para: Initiates a request to interrupt an edit procedure.

Docs.param: The number of the row in which an edit operation is being interrupted.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override bool Commit (System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager dataSource, int rowNum);

remarks.para: The method checks to ensure that an edit is indeed occurring. If so, it formats the value appropriately. If the value is null, the method enters into the column; otherwise, it uses the method to commit the value.
The method is called by the when an editing operation is committed.

summary.para: Inititates a request to complete an editing procedure.

returns.para: true if the value was successfully committed; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: The of the control the column belongs to.
The number of the edited row.

remarks.para: In this overridden method, the control hosted by the is hidden.

summary.para: Informs the column that the focus is being conceded.

remarks.para: The sites a control on the grid at the location of the cell being edited. The method is called by the class's method when an editing operation is about to begin.

summary.para: Prepares a cell for editing.

Docs.param: The of the control the column belongs to.
The row number in this column being edited.
The bounding in which the control is to be sited.
A value indicating whether the column is a read-only. true if the value is read-only; otherwise, false.
The text to display in the control.
A value indicating whether the cell is visible. true if the cell is visible; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: To edit the value of a cell, call the object's before changing the value. You must invoke the method on both the and objects before the change is committed.

summary.para: Ends an edit operation on the .

remarks.para: Enters the value into the cell.

summary.para: Enters a in the column.

remarks.para: The property specifies how values are displayed in the column. For example, set the property to "c" to specify that the values will be formatted as the local currency. The for the computer is used to determine the actual currency format. The values are automatically unformatted to the native type when data is changed.
For more information about formatting characters, see Formatting Types and Custom DateTime Format Strings.
The format you apply should be appropriate to the data type. For example, if the data is numeric in nature use one of the numeric format strings.
You can change the for a by setting the property to a new instance constructed with an appropriate culture ID.
To set the for the application, set the property of the object to a new instance constructed with an appropriate culture ID.

summary.para: Gets or sets the character(s) that specify how text is formatted.

remarks.para: When setting the property to one of the formatting characters, the uses the information provided by the property to further specify what cultural-specific formatting to use. For example, when the property is set to the format character "c" (for currency), you can further specify that the symbol for the lira be used. To do this, create a new object with the locale ID for Italy, and set the property to the new object.
For more information about formatting characters, see Formatting Types and Custom DateTime Format Strings.

summary.para: Gets or sets the culture specific information used to determine how values are formatted.

remarks.para: The value returned by is calculated by adding the size of the column's font plus a margin value.

remarks.para: The optimum width and height is calculated by measuring the string size, taking into account its font and attributes, and adding margin values.
